title: All the new movies and TV shows streaming in February
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: February streaming highlights include romantic classics like 'You’ve Got Mail' and 'When Harry Met Sally' on Netflix and HBO Max.
Black History Month sees films like Spike Lee's 'Malcolm X' on HBO Max and Ava DuVernay’s 'Selma' on Peacock.
New premieres include 2025 films 'Splitsville' on Hulu, 'Kiss of the Spider Woman' on Hulu, and 'Eternity' on Apple TV.

title: Here’s how much a gig worker makes in Somerville
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: A Somerville gig worker, C.B., earns $22,000 annually after business expenses from multiple part-time jobs.
C.B., age 52, manages expenses by owning and subletting a condo and living frugally in Somerville.
Her part-time roles include dog walking, consulting, ADHD coaching, and managing properties for local landlords.

title: More Harvard connections to Epstein revealed in newly released documents
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Physics professor Lisa Randall exchanged emails and flew on Jeffrey Epstein's jet despite his 2008 conviction.
Harvard Hillel fundraisers solicited donations from Epstein post-conviction, leading to revised ethical fundraising guidelines.
Harvard received $9 million from Epstein, and previously sanctioned faculty due to affiliations with him.

title: Here’s what Boston meteorologists are saying about ‘the potential for record-breaking cold’ this weekend
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: NWS Boston warns of dangerously low wind chills this weekend, potentially reaching -15° to -25° with gusty winds.
A clipper system is expected Friday night, bringing light snow followed by an Arctic surge of cold, dry air.
Meteorologists predict potential record-breaking cold for the weekend, with notable impact from the Arctic air mass.

title: WBZ’s Steve Burton shared a ‘humbling moment’ during Super Bowl week, and people loved it
author: John Waller
bullets: Steve Burton shared a photo with a billboard of his daughter Veronica Burton during Super Bowl week in the Bay Area.
Veronica Burton plays for the WNBA's Golden State Valkyries and was the No. 7 pick in the 2002 draft.
WBZ-TV producer Joe Giza shared a video of Burton being recognized as 'Veronica's dad' by a passerby.

title: Scituate’s Mike Macdonald has ‘evolved’ from his Red Sox fandom. He’s scheming to take down the Patriots.
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Seahawks head coach Mike Macdonald, a native of Massachusetts, aims to defeat the Patriots in the upcoming Super Bowl.
Macdonald grew up a Patriots and Red Sox fan but now supports the Seattle teams he leads, including the Mariners.
Under Macdonald's coaching, the Seahawks allowed the fewest points in the NFL, emphasizing their strong defensive identity.

title: ‘Jeopardy!’ featured a Massachusetts colleges category. Can you run the table?
author: John Waller
bullets: 'Jeopardy!' featured a 'Schooling You in Massachusetts' category during Monday's 'Tournament of Champions' game.
The $1,200 clue about Brandeis University was unanswered by contestants in the Massachusetts colleges category.
The 'Schooling You in Massachusetts' category included clues about Smith, Amherst, Northeastern, and Mount Holyoke colleges.

title: ‘May the best team win’: Tom Brady’s evasive answer regarding his Super Bowl LX rooting interest
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Tom Brady gives a noncommittal response about his Super Bowl LX rooting interest, indicating he supports people he cares about.
Brady admits he isn't specifically rooting for the Patriots, stating, 'May the best team win' in the Super Bowl.
Brady acknowledges his career achievements can't be diminished and praises the Patriots' new era under Mike Vrabel.

title: Got an ice dam? Here’s what to do.
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Ice dams form when melted roof water refreezes at roof edges, potentially causing leaks and structural damage.
Homeowners should beware large icicles and ice forming from soffits, indicating potential water buildup and leaking.
Prevent ice dams by removing roof snow, improving attic insulation, and ensuring proper attic ventilation, experts advise.

title: Trump is said to have dropped demand for cash from Harvard
author: New York Times Service
bullets: Trump no longer demands $200 million from Harvard in negotiations over university handling of antisemitism, officials say.
Trump seeks $1 billion in damages from Harvard, suggesting criminal investigations into the university's actions.
Harvard board to discuss Trump's latest concession, weighing impacts on federal research grants and university independence.
